definition: to write as substitute for sb/a ghost writer/plagiarism
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: Objective: To explore the advantages of septoplasty by nasal endoscope.
sentences.chinese: 探討鼻代寫職稱論文內鏡下鼻中隔成形術的治療效果。

sentences.english: More medical paper how to write for the price?
sentences.chinese: 更多代寫醫學論文價格如何？

sentences.english: The Wuchang let the fortune teller to write with notices.
sentences.chinese: 那五常讓算命先生代寫應戰告示。
她的回憶錄是由別人代寫的。

sentences.english: I ghosted his weekly rugby column for the Telegraph.
sentences.chinese: 我爲他代寫《電訊報》每週的橄欖球專欄。

sentences.english: The pressure to publish has created a ghostwriting boom.
sentences.chinese: 發表論文的壓力已經掀起了代寫的高潮。

sentences.english: His will was written by his wife.
sentences.chinese: 他的遺囑是由他妻子代寫的。

sentences.english: Many celebrities hire ghost writers to write their biography.
sentences.chinese: 有很多名人都聘請捉刀人代寫他們的傳記。

sentences.english: P. S. This letter is written by other guy I asked on the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 順便提一句，這郵件是我在網上請人代寫的。

sentences.english: He devilled an article for the writer.
sentences.chinese: 他替作家代寫了一篇文章。

sentences.english: In the process of generation write master thesis?
sentences.chinese: 在代寫碩士論文過程中？

sentences.english: He makes a living ghostwriting the autobiographies of raddled showbiz veterans.
sentences.chinese: 他靠爲過氣的做秀人物代寫自傳爲生。

definition: East China Normal University/abbr. for 華東師範大學|华东师范大学[Hua2 dong1 Shi1 fan4 Da4 xue2]
Chinese phonetics (concerned also with rhyme in poetry)
lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it

the Book of History, one of the Five Classics of Confucianism 五經|五经[Wu3 jing1], a compendium of documents which make up the oldest extant texts of Chinese history, from legendary times down to the time of Confucius, also known as 尚書經|尚书经[Shang4 shu1 jing1], 尚書|尚书[Shang4 shu1], 書|书[Shu1]
colloquial (rather than literary) pronunciation of a Chinese character
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
The Travels of Lao Tsan, novel by late Qing novelist Liu E 劉鶚|刘鹗[Liu2 E4]
